intro: Micropsis australis, commonly known as the Australian dwarf lily, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Australia. It features small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces elongated flower stalks. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal or sandy environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
